ai.summary: A short and easy 2.9 km circuit around Derwent Dam in the United Kingdom. Suitable for beginners and families, this route offers reservoir and dam wall views with gentle paths and minimal elevation gain.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly well defined paths along the dam crest and surrounding woodland. Mostly flat to gently rolling with occasional uneven gravel sections and minor steps near access points. Open sections may be exposed to wind.
ai.safety_notes: Stay on marked trails and heed safety signs. Be mindful of other visitors and cyclists on shared routes. Weather near the water can change quickly; wear layered clothing and bring a waterproof layer. Maintain a safe distance from the dam edge and supervise children. Carry a map or GPS and keep a charged phone for emergencies.
recommended_gear: Map or GPS device / Smartphone with offline map
ai.best_seasons: All year round; best conditions in late spring to early autumn when paths are dry and views are clearer. Winter visits can be windy and slippery.

seo.title: Derwent Dam Red Route – Easy 2.9 km Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the 2.9 km Derwent Dam Red Route in the UK. This easy, family friendly hike around Derwent Dam offers scenic reservoir views, gentle paths, and accessible terrain.
seo.h1: Derwent Dam Red Route – Easy 2.9 km Hike
